Dialogue.Page: So it’s launch day, huh? Hal’s going to miss you.
Speaking of launch day... I was thinking about it, and the platform those ships launch from is getting old. Isn’t it about time you built a new, less flammable one?
That big tree in the village would be the perfect choice. I wouldn’t mind helping out the space program. Just say the word!

DialogueOption.Text: I've got something better for you to work your axe on than that tree, Marl. A bramble seed just landed on Timber Hearth!
The current launch pad is fine, thanks.
Nice try. We all know you have it out for that tree.

Dialogue.Page: Wait, isn't the bramble that horrible plant that destroyed a whole planet in the star system? Chert once told me about it around the campfire.
Isn't one of its seeds being here really, really bad news?
Hey, me and Hal'll take care of this little business quick-like in no time. Don't worry about it, and enjoy your launch! Promise this place'll still be in one piece by the time you get back.
Worst case? Heh. This bramble seed's gonna learn real quick that no tree - or plant - is safe from burning up on Timber Hearth.
Hey, d'you think we could make a new launch pad out of the bramble seed after we hack it up? Wouldn't that be sick?
Well, maybe someone needs a new porch or something. <Pause>A big one.
What? No, I just think it’s in the way and someone ought to chop it down, you know? Specifically, me.
...Haha, you think this has to do with the time I fell out of it and broke my arm? That was when we were hatchlings! Who would hold a grudge for that long?
Don’t worry, it’s held up for all the launches so far. It’ll definitely be fine for yours. Probably.
If you swing by the moon, say hi to Esker for me.
What are you doing back? Did you forget your spacesuit or something?
